body:
maybe it's me being blind in the morning - but where do you skip `-1` here? if the first time the loop exits, further ones would still short-circuting immediately, I think `++idx` after the loop is missing

Also, it might be a better option to have flexible arg names. E.g. instead of encoding everything together you can have separate arguments like `output_size_hint_0`, `output_size_hint_1`, etc. I think it's more readable and less error prone

Also, it might be a better option to have flexible arg names. E.g. instead of encoding everything together you can have separate arguments like output_size_hint_0, output_size_hint_1, etc. I think it's more readable and less error prone
body_text:
maybe it's me being blind in the morning - but where do you skip -1 here? if the first time the loop exits, further ones would still short-circuting immediately, I think ++idx after the loop is missing
Also, it might be a better option to have flexible arg names. E.g. instead of encoding everything together you can have separate arguments like output_size_hint_0, output_size_hint_1, etc. I think it's more readable and less error prone
